summary:
Saraswati is a very important goddess in Hinduism, Jainism, and Buddhism. She is known as the goddess of knowledge, education, and the arts. Saraswati was first linked to the Sarasvati River, but later became associated with speech and language. She is often shown with four arms, holding a book, rosary, water pot, and a musical instrument.

She is respected for her role in learning and culture. People celebrate her on Vasant Panchami, a spring festival, where children learn to write. Saraswati is also honored in temples worldwide. In Buddhism, she is known as Benzaiten, and in Jainism, she spreads the teachings of Tirthankaras.
title: Saraswati
